basics.name: Daniel Larner
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with hands-on experience in all layers of development. Working specifically with NodeJS, Angular, and AWS. Experience with .NET Framework (and Core), C#, SQL Server, and Entity Framework. Worked in Agile/SCRUM methodologies to speed up development processes.

work.summary: As part of the product Enhancement Engineering team, the team I work with develops the next generation features for use across the SingleComm platform. Responsibilities include working with your lead to develop requirements for new features, the full automated testing from unit tests to end to end testing, engineering SOLID code, building pipelines for deployment, and assisting the Product Support team with production issues.
highlights: Writing maintainable code with extensive test coverages
Building efficient, testable, and reusable typescript, Javascript, or scala code
Develop infrastructure to integrate and deliver code

work.summary: As a TA, I have helped students learn web development over the 6 month course. Helped students learn skills to then help companies bridge gaps in digital skills.
highlights: Helped students build a portfolio of web applications to showcase their knowledge
Helped students learn HTML5, CSS3, Java, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Express.js, React.js, Node.js, Database Theory, MongoDB, MySQL, Command Line, and Git

work.summary: Worked as a software developer to build internal tools for QA, integration, and regression testing. Devloped applications using MVC and Entity Framework for using in data masking processes.
highlights: Working in MS SQL Server 2012/2016 as development environment to read/write to databases
Making improvements to front end UI using Javascript and jQuery
Creating and manipulating test data for use in QA environments to replicate production scenarios

work.summary: Took part in building web and single-page applications using Agile/SCRUM methodologies. Built applications using the .NET Framework and .NET Core.
highlights: Gained experience in .NET Framework and .NET Core technologies building applications for clients in a CI/CD DevOps model
Wrote unit tests using NUnit to adhere to TDD and increase code coverage
Implemetned design principles (SOLID) and design patterns to enhance code rusability, extensibility, and maintainability

awards.title: AWS Certified Developer Associate
awards.summary: Demonstrate an understanding of core AWS services, uses, and basic AWS architecture best practices. Demonstrate proficiency in developing, deploying, and debugging cloud-based applications using AWS.
